node.plaintext:
In the end of 2017 I started to commute 50 kilometers a day. I found out that my
old Canyon Inflite Cyclocross bike was not perfect for that job. I wanted to
have no race bar, I didn't like to have a front deraillieur and the weight of
about 9,5 kg was also a little too high.

So I found out that Canyons new line of fitness bikes were pretty decent bikes.
Especially the top of the line Roadlite CF. The men version was alsmost exactly
what I wanted. Canyon used nice DT Swiss carbon rims and the SRAM Force 1
shifting group. BUT! I also looked at the women Roadlites and fond the wonderful
colour called "Meteor Grey - Red". I was instantly in love. The only problem was
that Canyon didn't sell this bike with the SRAM Force 1 shifting.

After some hard thinking and many calculations I ended up bying the Roadlite WMN
CF 7.0 with Shimano 105 shifting. I replaced it with SRAM Force 1 and I had to
buy new wheels because the DT Swiss hubs that came with the Roadlite SF 7.0
weren't compatible with Srams DX driver body. I got DT Swisss ER 1400 wheels.
Those are even lighter than the carbon rims of the Roadlite CF 9.0.

In addition to those important changes I also bought my first power meter for
this bike. Because of the Sram shifting I decided to pick the Quarq DZero. The
last thing I replaced was the saddle. I use now on every bike my beloved (and
very light) Tune Speedneedle.

Now I have a truly light (7,4 kg) commuter. I ride it for almost a year now and
I rode 6212 km with it. I just replaced the chain the first time. It feels like
a really solid bicycle.

node.plaintext:
I thought I would start with a series featuring the bikes I have at the moment.
Starting with my oldest one.

I always likes cycling. In 2008 I started to ride more and more off road. So I 
needed a real mountainbike. What I wanted back then was a full suspension all
mountain bike. But I was in the middle of my study and didn't have much money.
After I started my first job I was able to by a Cube LTD CC. This is a hardtail
XC bike with 80 mm of front suspension.

This bike was good enough to get the mountainbiking flame in my heart light up.
In the following years I participated in several marathon races in south-west
Germany with this bike.

In 2013 I lived in berlin and the Cube was just my secondary bike by then. It
was rarely used and I didn't really maintain it very well. So in 2016 the Cube
was completely unridable. The shifting was rusty and the bike became a single
speed bike, despite having a cassette and a front deraillieur. Luckily I made
the decision to not sell it for 10‚Ç¨ but rebuild it as a city bike. I bought a
new wheelset and mounted the SRAM NX group. This was my first try with a one-by
system. It was a really good decision because suddenly the bike became my
favourite bike although I had another mountainbike and a race bike by then. I
used the bike to get around Berlin. Sometimes even with a trailer.

The city bike.This is still the state of the Cube. But now I have a much longer
commute to do every day. Now I use this bike very rarely for grocery shopping or
other short rides in our village. Sometimes guests use it, but that's it. At the
moment I don't really know what to do with it. If I'm honest I don't need it
anymore. But I still like it. And maybe at some point I will need it again more
often for shopping. So I will keep it for now as long as it doesn't bother me.

node.meta_description: A short introduction for my new little blog about mountainbiking and other cycling topics.
node.plaintext:
Hi everyone! I am Juuro and this is my blog about mountainbiking. Despite I
already have a blog [http://blog.i-wars.net] for many years I feel it is finally
time to start a seperate blog that's solely dedicated to mountainbiking.

What will happen here?
To be honest I don't know yet exactly. There's no marketing concept, this is a
private ¬†blog about my favourite hobby. But there are some types of posts you
can expect:

 1. There will for sure be race reports. Last season I was present at three UCI
    Cross Country races. One of them were the world championships in
    Lenzerheide. The other two were the worldcup races in Albstadt and La
    Bresse.
 2. I will write about new products and prototypes I see at those races ¬†or find
    online. For example in Lenzerheide I did a first shift with the still
    unanounced electric SRAM XX1.
 3. This year I bought a new mountainbike (and a new bike for commuting). There
    will be posts about building up bikes.
 4. I will do races myself. Most of them are marathon races. I have to tell
    someone about my expieriences tehre.
 5. Maybe there will be some tour reports. In the past years I rode once through
    the alps and I tried to ride from berlin to south Germany - not so
    successful.
 6. General cycling topics. While my main interest is about mountainbiking I
    will also write about other topic that concern cyclists. At the moment the
    by far biggest par of my cycling is done during commutes. So I will maybe
    write about other kinds of bikes and more theoretical topics like the
    "Zweimeter-Regel" (A rule in the German state of Baden-W√ºrttemberg that
    forbids ccyclists to use paths less than two meters wide.).

Ok, enough with the introduction. Let's go for the first real post.
